text:
What package should I use for checking if two expressions are equal, like the following Mathematica code?
```Equivalent[p && (q || r), (p && q) || (p && r)] // TautologyQ```
Is there a pure Julia library or do all of the symbolic manipulation packages call external libraries?

elements.text: What package should I use for checking if two expressions are equal, like the following Mathematica code?
Is there a pure Julia library or do all of the symbolic manipulation packages call external libraries?

text:
SymbolicUtils.jl and Symbolics.jl are pure Julia symbolic libraries, but I’m not sure there are rewrite rules for Boolean expressions.

But you can just substitute in all possible combinations of true and false and check that the results are same

elements.text:

text: (assuming there are not too many variables)

elements.text: (assuming there are not too many variables)

text: Note that you need `&` and `|`,  not `&&` and `||`, in Julia
You can set up your own rewrite rules using SymbolicUtils.jl

elements.text: You can set up your own rewrite rules using SymbolicUtils.jl
